Full-offence Dual-wielding Weapon master: Fighter 10 Weaponmaster 28 Rogue 2

This is a build made to kill enemies before PC gets killed.
most of feats and ability points focus on offence to guarantee devastating damage, attack speed and high ab while giving up bit of ac, saving throw
Still, this character's offence ability is attractive to those who wants a glass melee nuker

5. Adavantages&Weaknesses

Adavantages

40-55 % of critical hits 
6-7 attacks per round

Thank you for your comment! There are two main reasons i use kukri instead of long sword

first of all, long sword is a medium weapon, meaning that if you wield two longswords you will have -4 penalty on ab
on the other hand, kukri is a tiny weapon so ab penalty from dual wielding decreases to 2

Secondly, long sword has a threat range of 20, which means that it will make critical hits percentage to 5%
even with keen, ki critical, and improved critical,   threat range of long sword is 16-20 so critical percentage is 25% at maximum
if you take kukri its base threat range is 18-20, so it will have critical percentage of 15%
with improved critical, ki critical, and keen kukri's threat range is 10-20, so it will have critical percentage of 55%, which is very high compared to that of long sword's

* about the +16strength, as long as i know the base ability cap is 12, so even if you have +16  str sword your str will only go up 12 

Btw, english is not first language for me either ;)

Thank you for your comment, i couldn't find a weapon master build here, so i didn't know there are similar builds in other sites
Still, i have looked up for the builds that you said are similar to mine, and i can say those builds are not really different from my build in a big picture, but the details are the part seperates my build from others

Firstly, none of the five 28 WM rogue 2 fighter 10 builds focuses on dual-wielding kukri
4 of the builds use two handed weapon, so they are completely diffrent from my build

The third build is the one that shares a lot with my build 
same ability points, similiar feats

However if you look at the details, you can see my build and third one is not completely same,

third build you have posted focused on two weapons(katana and mace) by sacrificing overwhelming and devastating critical
In addition, there are many more difference in feats if you take a closer look
ex) 1. third build took improvised expertise which i didn't take
       2. i took blind-fight which third build didn't take 
      etc..

The reason i think my build is better than other WM/rogue/fighter build(no offence to those builders, cuz they are the ones who made the bones of the build i just sharpened it a little)

critical hits percentage, minimum loss of ab

all the rogue 2/ fighter 10/ wm 28 build didn't focus on either scimitar or kukri or rapiers
they are only three weapons with threat range of 18-20
since Wm focuses a lot on attack per round and critical hits

its probably best to choose from scimitar, rapier or kukri

I didn't choose neither scimitar or rapier, because when you dual-wield medium sized weapon in off-hand ab is lowered by 4 points
However, if you wield a small(for medium sized creatures) or tiny(for small or larger creatures) ab penalty is lowered by 2 points

since importance of base damage fades as you get higher enchanted weapons, i decided to focus on kukri( with devastating critical hits, damage doesn't really matter cuz you get 55% critical hits and your attack per round is 6(4 by main hand, 2 by off-hand)

thank you again for reading and plz understand my poor english, since i'm not a native speaker

posts.author: unifiedworld
posts.content:
Just so guys know, HoU and the other official campaigns are designed so you can beat them with pretty much any beginner build you put together. If you want a challenge, then you'll want to play an advanced module or in a persistent world. I highly recommend Swordflight if you're looking for a single-player challenge. World of Greyhawk is an excellent persistent world if you'd like a more dynamic challenge (though in many ways, Swordflight can actually be more challenging since xp and resources are limited in a single-player module and there are some enemies you simply have to fight - you can't just go find a different area to get xp if an area is too difficult for you).

If you adjust your in-game ability caps to go beyond 12, the game will feel even easier. I highly recommend against it.

If you do try out Swordflight and if you're able to get through it on Hardcore difficulty, start over on Very Difficult for an extra challenge :)

Best,

P.S. Here is a similar build I found by accident today: kukri-saint-fighter-12-wm-25-rogue-3-t2353598.html However, yours does seem stronger at first glance, since it includes Devastating Critical. I don't have time to compare them in detail.
